title: JAM / COALITION WARSHIP ARCHER -- SOONA VERSION
description: CUTSCENE where you attempt to contact Coalition Warship Archer with SOONA. PART OF THE MORALIST DREAM QUEST

dialogueTree.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And now if you'll just connect tha..."
dialogueTree.english: "And now if you'll just connect that here..."
dialogueTree.polish: „I jeśli teraz podłączysz to do tego...”
dialogueTree.belarusian: "І калі цяпер падключыш гэта да гэтага..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's done. I believe we're ready."..."
links.english: "It's done. I believe we're ready." The lieutenant wipes his brow.
links.polish: „Zrobione. Zdaje się, że jesteśmy gotowi” – odpowiada porucznik, ocierając czoło.
links.belarusian: "Зроблена. Здаецца, мы гатовыя", — адказвае лейтэнант, выціраючы лоб.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We're ready to try, at least. Plea..."
links.english: "We're ready to try, at least. Please, put on these headphones, there should be two extra sets. I've configured the channels so that only your microphone is set to broadcast, officer. We'll all be able to listen, but anyone we reach will only hear *your* voice."
links.polish: „Gotowi przynajmniej, żeby spróbować. Załóż, proszę, te słuchawki, powinny być dwa dodatkowe zestawy. Skonfigurowałam kanały tak, że tylko twój mikrofon będzie ustawiony na nadawanie. Wszyscy będziemy mogli słuchać, ale ten, z kim się połączymy, usłyszy tylko *twój* głos”.
links.belarusian: "Гатовы, прынамсі, каб паспрабаваць. Апрані, калі ласка, гэтыя навушнікі, павінна быць два дадатковыя камплекты. Я наладзіла каналы такім чынам, што толькі твой мікрафон будзе ўсталяваны на перадачу. Усе мы зможам слухаць, але той, з кім мы злучымся, пачуе толькі *твой* голас".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You will need to transmit your con..."
links.english: "You will need to transmit your connection request while I attempt to locate the warship's public frequency. You will likely encounter some interference, but it's important to keep transmitting your request until you're acknowledged. Ready?"
links.polish: „Będziesz musiał przesłać swoją prośbę o połączenie, a ja w tym czasie spróbuję zlokalizować publiczną częstotliwość okrętu. Natkniesz się pewnie na jakieś zakłócenia, ale najważniejsze, żebyś nadawał prośbę, dopóki nie otrzymasz potwierdzenia. Gotowy?”
links.belarusian: "Табе давядзецца адправіць свой запыт на злучэнне, а я ў гэты час паспрабую знайсці публічную частату карабля. Напэўна сутыкнешся з нейкімі перашкодамі, але галоўнае — працягвай перадаваць запыт, пакуль не атрымаш пацвярджэнне. Гатовы?"

links.title: You: ""Wait, what if they *never* acknowl..."
links.english: "Wait, what if they *never* acknowledge me?"
links.polish: „Czekaj, a co jeśli nikt *nigdy* nie potwierdzi odbioru?”
links.belarusian: "Чакай, а што, калі ніхто *ніколі* не пацвердзіць атрымання?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then it will be exactly like every..."
links.english: "Then it will be exactly like every other moment of every other day. I ask again: Are you ready?"
links.polish: „Wtedy będzie tak samo, jak w każdej innej chwili każdego innego dnia. Pytam jeszcze raz: gotowy?”
links.belarusian: "Тады будзе так жа, як у любую іншую хвіліну кожнага іншага дня. Я пытаюся яшчэ раз: гатовы?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Good. Beginning transmission.""
links.english: "Good. Beginning transmission."
links.polish: „Dobrze. Rozpoczynam nadawanie”.
links.belarusian: "Добра. Пачынаю вяшчанне".

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Shivers: "A soft rustling. The snow seems to..."
links.english: A soft rustling. The snow seems to have gotten between your ears somehow...
links.polish: Delikatny szmer. Śnieg dostał ci się chyba jakoś między uszy...
links.belarusian: Далікатны шум. Снег, напэўна, нейкім чынам трапіў табе паміж вушы...

links.title: You: "Where's the sound coming from?"
links.english: Where's the sound coming from?
links.polish: Skąd dochodzi ten dźwięk?
links.belarusian: Адкуль даходзіць гэты гук?

links.title: Shivers: "Every lightswitch, every motor carr..."
links.english: Every lightswitch, every motor carriage, every doorbell, tea kettle, and radio in Martinaise, all mingled with electrical interference caused by scattered thunderstorms over Ozonne.
links.polish: Z każdego włącznika światła, każdego powozu motorowego, dzwonka do drzwi, czajnika i radia w Martinaise. Wszystko to miesza się z elektrycznymi zakłóceniami powodowanymi przez błąkające się nad Ozonne burze.
links.belarusian: З кожнага выключальніка святла, кожнага маторнага экіпажа, званка ў дзверы, чайніка і радыё ў Мартынайсе. Усё гэта змешваецца з электрычнымі перашкодамі, выкліканымі блукаючымі над Азонамі навальніцамі.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Officer? Are you in order? We're w..."
links.english: "Officer? Are you in order? We're waiting for you to start..."
links.polish: „Przepraszam? Wszystko w porządku? Czekamy, aż zaczniesz...”
links.belarusian: "Прабачце? Усё ў парадку? Чакаем, пакуль вы пачнеце..."

links.title: You: "Ignore it."
links.english: Ignore it.
links.polish: Zignoruj go.
links.belarusian: Ігнаруй яго.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Go ahead, officer.""
links.english: "Go ahead, officer."
links.polish: „Możesz zaczynać”.
links.belarusian: "Можаш пачынаць".

links.title: You: ""What should I say?""
links.english: "What should I say?"
links.polish: „Co mam powiedzieć?”
links.belarusian: "Што мне сказаць?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We don't have time for indecision...."
links.english: "We don't have time for indecision. Just say whatever first comes to mind."
links.polish: „Nie ma czasu na niezdecydowanie. Powiedz pierwsze, co ci przyjdzie do głowy”.
links.belarusian: "Няма часу на нявызначанасць. Скажы першае, што прыйдзе ў галаву".

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is RCM Officer Firewalker. Please acknowledge."
links.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu funkcjonariusz MOR-u, Ognisty. Potwierdź odbiór”.
links.belarusian: "Вайсковы карабель Кааліцыі Лукнік, тут афіцэр РГМ, Агністы. Пацвердзіце прыём".

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Inland Empire: "You're all alone out there, wanderi..."
links.english: You're all alone out there, wandering a blasted heath, calling out to the night, but there is no reply, except for the buzzing of invisible machines...
links.polish: Jesteś tam zupełnie sam, błąkasz się po zniszczonym pustkowiu, wołając w noc. Nikt jednak nie odpowiada, słyszysz tylko szum niewidzialnych maszyn...
links.belarusian: Ты там зусім адзін, блукаеш па знішчанай пустэчы, клічаш у ноч. Але ніхто не адказвае, ты толькі чуеш шум нябачных машын...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up at you with..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks up at you with a nervous glance.
links.polish: Porucznik obrzuca cię nerwowym spojrzeniem.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант нервова глядзіць на цябе.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He is nervous for your sake, of cou..."
links.english: He is nervous for your sake, of course, but also his own.
links.polish: Denerwuje się za ciebie, rzecz jasna, ale za siebie trochę też.
links.belarusian: Я, вядома, хвалююся за цябе, але трохі і за сябе таксама.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Looking at him now, with both hands..."
links.english: Looking at him now, with both hands on his headphones, you see very briefly what the lieutenant must have been like when he first joined the RCM...
links.polish: Kiedy spoglądasz na porucznika teraz, jak trzyma obie dłonie na słuchawkach, widzisz przez moment, jaki musiał być, kiedy dołączał do MOR-u...
links.belarusian: Калі ты глядзіш на лейтэнанта зараз, як ён трымае абедзве рукі на слухаўках, бачыш на імгненне, якім ён павінен быў быць, калі далучаўся да РГМ...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Then he turns to you. He gives you..."
links.english: Then he turns to you. He gives you a half smile along with an almost imperceptible nod of encouragement.
links.polish: Później odwraca się do ciebie. Rzuca ci półuśmiech i niemal niedostrzegalnie kiwa głową dla zachęty.
links.belarusian: Потым паварочваецца да цябе. Кідае табе паўусмешку і амаль незаўважна ківае галавой для заахвочвання.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Then he turns to you. His expressio..."
links.english: Then he turns to you. His expression seems to say, 'You'd better not leave this mess for me alone'.
links.polish: Później odwraca się do ciebie. Jego mina zdaje się mówić: „lepiej nie zostawiaj tego bałaganu tylko mnie”.
links.belarusian: Пазней ён паварочваецца да цябе. Яго твар, здаецца, кажа: "лепш не пакідай гэты беспарадак толькі мне".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Then he turns to you. He shakes his..."
links.english: Then he turns to you. He shakes his head slightly and looks back at the amplifier.
links.polish: Później odwraca się do ciebie. Kręci delikatnie głową, po czym spogląda ponownie na wzmacniacz.
links.belarusian: Пазней ён паварочваецца да цябе. Лёгка ківае галавой, пасля чаго зноў глядзіць на ўзмацняльнік.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Nervous for who, though, you cannot..."
links.english: Nervous for who, though, you cannot say.
links.polish: Za kogo się jednak denerwuje? Nie umiesz stwierdzić.
links.belarusian: За каго ўсё ж хвалюешся? Не можаш вызначыць.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Try again, officer.""
links.english: "Try again, officer."
links.polish: „Spróbuj jeszcze raz”.
links.belarusian: "Паспрабуй яшчэ раз".

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Firewalker. Please acknowledge."
links.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu Ognisty. Potwierdź odbiór”.
links.belarusian: "Карабель Вайсковай Кааліцыі "Лучнік", гэта "Агністы". Пацвердзіце прыём".

Alternate1.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Tequila Sunset. Please acknowledge."
Alternate1.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu Tequila Sunset. Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Ваенны карабель кааліцыі «Лучнік», тут Tequila Sunset. Пацвердзіць прыём».

Alternate2.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Detective Costeau. Please acknowledge."
Alternate2.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu detektyw Costeau. Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate2.belarusian: «Вайсковы карабель кааліцыі «Лучнік», тут дэтэктыў Касто. Пацвердзіце прыём».

Alternate3.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Lieutenant Du Bois. Please acknowledge."
Alternate3.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu porucznik Du Bois. Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate3.belarusian: «Вайсковы карабель Кааліцыі «Лук», тут лейтэнант Дэ Буа. Пацвердзіце атрыманне».

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Perception (Hearing): "Perhaps you're simply imagining it,..."
links.english: Perhaps you're simply imagining it, but it seems as though you're learning to pull apart the fibres of this auditory felt. You focus on one strand in particular, one that sounds very nearly human...
links.polish: Może ci się tylko wydaje, ale masz wrażenie, jakbyś uczył się rozdzierać włókna tego dźwiękowego filcu. Skupiasz się na jednym, konkretnym z nich, tym, który wydaje się brzmieć niemal ludzko...
links.belarusian: Можа, табе толькі здаецца, але ў цябе ўражанне, быццам ты вучышся рваць валокны гэтай гукавой фетры. Сконцэнтруйся на адным, канкрэтным з іх, тым, які, здаецца, гучыць амаль чалавечна...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Nein, Liebling! Das lasse ich nich..."
links.english: "Nein, Liebling! Das lasse ich nicht zu … Wie kannst du unseren Jungen bloß auf einem dieser *Dinger* nach Vredefort schicken?"
links.polish: „Nein, Liebling! Das lasse ich nicht zu… Wie kannst du unseren Jungen bloß auf einem dieser *Dinger* nach Vredefort schicken?”
links.belarusian: "Nein, Liebling! Das lasse ich nicht zu … Wie kannst du unseren Jungen bloß auf einem dieser *Dinger* nach Vredefort schicken?"

links.title: You: ""Hello... Archer? Do you acknowledg..."
links.english: "Hello... Archer? Do you acknowledge?"
links.polish: „Halo? Łucznik? Potwierdzacie?”
links.belarusian: "Гало? Луцнік? Пацвярджаеце?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Marianne ... mir erzählt, dass Osk..."
links.english: "Marianne ... mir erzählt, dass Oskar nicht mehr ... seit er auf einem Luftschiff aus Graad zurückgekommen ... halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal ... aber sie hat das Gefühl ... seit seiner Rückkehr ... einem Fremden zusammenzuleben..."
links.polish: „Marianne ...mir erzählt, dass Oskar nicht mehr ...seit er auf einem Luftschiff aus Graad zurückgekommen ...halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal ...aber sie hat das Gefühl ...seit seiner Rückkehr ...einem Fremden zusammenzuleben...”
links.belarusian: "Marianne ... mir erzählt, dass Oskar nicht mehr ... seit er auf einem Luftschiff aus Graad zurückgekommen ... halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal ... aber sie hat das Gefühl ... seit seiner Rückkehr ... einem Fremden zusammenzuleben..."

Alternate1.english: "Marianne hat mir erzählt, dass Oskar nicht mehr derselbe ist, seit er auf einem Luftschiff aus Graad zurückgekommen ist. Natürlich halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal, aber sie hat das Gefühl, seit seiner Rückkehr mit einem Fremden zusammenzuleben..."
Alternate1.polish: „Marianne hat mir erzählt, dass Oskar nicht mehr derselbe ist, seit er auf einem Luftschiff aus Graad zurückgekommen ist. Natürlich halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal, aber sie hat das Gefühl, seit seiner Rückkehr mit einem Fremden zusammenzuleben...”
Alternate1.belarusian: «Марыянна расказала мне, што Оскар стаў не такім, як быў раней, з таго часу, як ён вярнуўся на цепеліне з Граду. Вядома, што псіхолагі лічаць яго цалкам нармальным, але яна адчувае, што з моманту яго вяртання жыве з іншым чалавекам...»

links.title: Rhetoric: "Something about her son going to Vr..."
links.english: Something about her son going to Vredefort on an aerostatic... to see some psychologists? Or maybe it's the psychologists saying it's normal... to have feelings for strangers? Foreign languages were never your strong suit.
links.polish: Coś o jej synu udającym się aerostatem do Vredefortu... żeby spotkać się z psychologami? A może to psychologowie mówią, że to normalne... czuć coś do obcych ludzi? Języki obce nigdy nie były twoją mocną stroną.
links.belarusian: Нешта аб яе сыне, які адпраўляецца на аэрастат у Врэдэфорт... каб сустрэцца з псіхолагамі? А можа быць, гэта псіхолагі кажуць, што нармальна... адчуваць нешта да чужых людзей? Замежныя мовы ніколі не былі тваёй моцнай бокам.

links.title: You: "What does this remind me of?"
links.english: What does this remind me of?
links.polish: Co mi to przypomina?
links.belarusian: Што гэта мне нагадвае?

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The rustling of dry autumn leaves...."
links.english: The rustling of dry autumn leaves. Waves breaking at a distance. A thousand wings beating at once.
links.polish: Szum suchych jesiennych liści. Odległy szum fal. Uderzenia tysiąca skrzydeł jednocześnie.
links.belarusian: Шум сухіх восеньскіх лістоў. Аддалены шум хваль. Удары тысячы крылаў адначасова.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's just like that woman in the el..."
links.english: It's just like that woman in the electronic doorbell... the circuit ghost...
links.polish: To tak jak ta kobieta w elektronicznym dzwonku... Duch w obwodzie...
links.belarusian: Гэта як тая жанчына ў электронным званку... Дух у контуры...

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's strangely comforting to think..."
links.english: It's strangely comforting to think of these voices travelling through the air, until you capture them, firefly-like, with your little metal antenna...
links.polish: Dziwnie kojąca jest dla ciebie myśl, że głosy te płyną przez powietrze, dopóki ich nie uchwycisz swoją metalową antenką, jak świetliki...
links.belarusian: Дзіўна суцешная для цябе думка, што гэтыя галасы плывуць праз паветра, пакуль ты іх не ўлавіш сваёй металічнай антэнкай, як светлячкі...

links.title: You: ""Soona, is this more of that entrop..."
links.english: "Soona, is this more of that entroponetic crosstalk?"
links.polish: „Soono, czy to znowu ten entroponetyczny przesłuch?”
links.belarusian: "Суну, ці гэта зноў той энтрапанетычны допыт?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.english: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."
links.polish: „Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen”.
links.belarusian: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's very likely, based on what we..."
links.english: "It's very likely, based on what we've recently learned. Give me a moment while I attempt to narrow the receiving mode..."
links.polish: „To bardzo prawdopodobne, biorąc pod uwagę, czego się ostatnio dowiedzieliśmy. Potrzebuję chwili, spróbuję zawęzić działanie trybu odbioru...”
links.belarusian: "Гэта вельмі верагодна, улічваючы тое, што мы даведаліся апошнім часам. Мне патрэбна хвіліна, паспрабую звузіць дзеянне рэжыму прыёму..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""In the meantime, you must keep try..."
links.english: "In the meantime, you must keep trying."
links.polish: „A na razie musisz po prostu próbować”.
links.belarusian: "А зараз табе проста трэба спрабаваць".

links.title: You: ""Soona, I think there are ghosts in..."
links.english: "Soona, I think there are ghosts in this radio."
links.polish: „Soono, w tym radiu chyba są duchy”.
links.belarusian: "Soono, у гэтым радыё, мабыць, ёсць прывіды".

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.english: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."
links.polish: „Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen”.
links.belarusian: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Not ghosts, officer. Crosstalk. Yo..."
links.english: "Not ghosts, officer. Crosstalk. You have to keep trying until we get a signal through."
links.polish: „To nie duchy, a przesłuch. Będziemy musieli próbować, dopóki nasz sygnał się nie przedrze”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта не духі, а перашкода. Нам давядзецца спрабаваць, пакуль наш сігнал не праб'ецца".

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Firewalker. If you're there, Archer, please acknowledge."
links.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu Ognisty. Jeśli mnie słyszysz, potwierdź odbiór”.
links.belarusian: "Кааліцыйны ваенны карабель "Лучнік", гэта "Агністы". Калі чуеш мяне, пацвердзі прыём".

Alternate1.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Tequila Sunset. If you're there, Archer, please acknowledge."
Alternate1.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu Tequila Sunset. Jeśli mnie słyszysz, potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Вайсковы Кораблі Кааліцыі Лучнік, гэта Tequila Sunset. Калі чуеце мяне, пацвердзіце прыём».

Alternate2.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Detective Costeau. If you're there, Archer, please acknowledge."
Alternate2.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu detektyw Costeau. Jeśli mnie słyszysz, potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate2.belarusian: «Ваенны карабель Кааліцыі «Лукнік», гэта дэтэктыў Косто. Калі мяне чуеце, пацвердзіце прыём».

Alternate3.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Lieutenant Du Bois. If you're there, Archer, please acknowledge."
Alternate3.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu porucznik Du Bois. Jeśli mnie słyszysz, potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate3.belarusian: «Ваенны карабель Кааліцыі Лучнік, тут лейтэнант Дзю Буа. Калі чуеце мяне, пацвердзіце прыём».

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Soona, the Programmer: ""Again.""
links.english: "Again."
links.polish: „Jeszcze raz”.
links.belarusian: "Яшчэ раз".

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Firewalker. Do you acknowledge?"
links.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu Ognisty. Potwierdzacie odbiór?”
links.belarusian: "Вайсковы карабель Кааліцыі Лукнік, тут Агонь. Пацвярджаеце прыём?"

Alternate1.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Tequila Sunset. Do you acknowledge?"
Alternate1.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu Tequila Sunset. Potwierdzacie odbiór?”
Alternate1.belarusian: «Карабель Ваеннага Флоту Кааліцыі «Лукнік», гэта Tequila Sunset. Ці пацвярджаеце прыём?»

Alternate2.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Detective Costeau. Do you acknowledge?"
Alternate2.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu detektyw Costeau. Potwierdzacie odbiór?”
Alternate2.belarusian: «Карабель Вайсковай Кааліцыі "Лукнік", гэта дэтэктыў Касто. Пацвярджаеце прыём?»

Alternate3.english: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Lieutenant Du Bois. Do you acknowledge?"
Alternate3.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik, tu porucznik Du Bois. Potwierdzacie odbiór?”
Alternate3.belarusian: «Ваенны карабель кааліцыі Лу́чнік, тут лейтэнант Дзю Буа. Пацвярджаеце прыём?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's cold now...""
links.english: "It's cold now..."
links.polish: „Zimno...”
links.belarusian: "Халаднавата..."

links.title: Shivers: "A slight frisson at the point where..."
links.english: A slight frisson at the point where your neck meets your spine. Something about the lieutenant's words, directed at you, but not *you*.
links.polish: Delikatny dreszcz w miejscu, gdzie kark łączy się z plecami. Spowodowały go słowa porucznika skierowane do ciebie, ale nie *ciebie*.
links.belarusian: Пяшчотны дрыжык у месцы, дзе шыя злучаецца са спінай. Яго выклікалі словы лейтэнанта, накіраваныя да цябе, але не *цябе*.

links.title: You: ""Kim, don't clog my connection.""
links.english: "Kim, don't clog my connection."
links.polish: „Kim, nie zakłócaj mi połączenia”.
links.belarusian: "Кім, не перашкаджай маему злучэнню".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I didn't say anything, detective.""
links.english: "I didn't say anything, detective."
links.polish: „Nic nie mówiłem, detektywie”.
links.belarusian: "Нічога не казаў, дэтэктыве".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...someone has been maintaining it..."
links.english: "...someone has been maintaining it. The wiring has been repaired..."
links.polish: „...ktoś go serwisował. Okablowanie było naprawiane...”
links.belarusian: "...хтось яго абслугоўваў. Праводка была адноўлена..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "An uncomfortable silence falls over..."
links.english: An uncomfortable silence falls over the connection.
links.polish: Na łączach zapada niezręczna cisza.
links.belarusian: На злучэннях настае няёмкае маўчанне.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... It's been a long winter... Lon..."
links.english: "... It's been a long winter... Long and cold..."
links.polish: „...To była długa zima... Długa i zimna...”
links.belarusian: "...Гэта была доўгая зіма... Доўгая і халодная..."

links.title: You: ""Are you going to tell me you didn'..."
links.english: "Are you going to tell me you didn't say *that*, either?"
links.polish: „I może *tego* też nie powiedziałeś?”
links.belarusian: "І можа *гэтага* таксама не сказаў?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I promise you, I didn't, even thou..."
links.english: "I promise you, I didn't, even though it certainly *sounds* like me..." The lieutenant seems to wince at the sound of his own voice.
links.polish: „Zapewniam, że tego nie powiedziałem, chociaż z pewnością *brzmi* to jak ja...” – porucznik zdaje się wzdragać na dźwięk własnego głosu.
links.belarusian: "Запэўніваю, што я гэтага не казаў, хаця, безумоўна, *гучыць* гэта як я..." – лейтэнант, здаецца, ажно здрыгануўся ад гуку свайго ўласнага голасу.

links.title: You: ""Could this be more entroponetic cr..."
links.english: "Could this be more entroponetic crosstalk?"
links.polish: „Czy to może znowu być entroponetyczny przesłuch?”
links.belarusian: "Ці можа гэта зноў быць энтрапанетычны допыт?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes," the programmer cuts in. "A p..."
links.english: "Yes," the programmer cuts in. "A particularly eerie specimen, but still just a harmless piece of the past returning to surface."
links.polish: „Tak” – wcina się programistka. „Wyjątkowo upiorny okaz, ale to nadal tylko powracający na powierzchnię świata, nieszkodliwy urywek przeszłości”.
links.belarusian: "Так", — умяшваецца праграмістка. "Выключна злавесны экзэмпляр, але ўсё ж гэта толькі вяртанне на паверхню свету, бяскрыўдны ўрывак мінулага".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right. I just wish I could remembe..."
links.english: "Right. I just wish I could remember what I was talking about..."
links.polish: „Jasne. Żałuję tylko, że nie pamiętam, o czym mówiłem...”
links.belarusian: "Зразумела. Шкадую толькі, што не памятаю, пра што казаў…"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Something here is eating at the lie..."
links.english: Something here is eating at the lieutenant, as much as he would like to move past it.
links.polish: Coś tu gryzie porucznika, choć bardzo chciałby o tym zapomnieć.
links.belarusian: Нешта тут турбуе лейтэнанта, хоць ён вельмі хацелася б пра гэта забыцца.

links.title: You: ""What is happening?""
links.english: "What is happening?"
links.polish: „Co się dzieje?”
links.belarusian: "Што адбываецца?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I can't say with certainty, but it..."
links.english: "I can't say with certainty, but it *sounds* very much like entroponetic crosstalk. It happens sometimes when sending transmissions across long stretches of pale."
links.polish: „Pewności nie mam, ale *brzmi to* jak entroponetyczny przesłuch. Czasem do niego dochodzi podczas transmisji nadawanych nad dużymi połaciami szaroty”.
links.belarusian: "Пэўнасці не маю, але *гучыць гэта* як энтрапанетычны перашляд. Часам ён бывае падчас трансляцый, якія вядуцца над вялікімі плошчамі шэрасці".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, yes, of course. That must be i..."
links.english: "Ah, yes, of course. That must be it..."
links.polish: „A tak, oczywiście. To musi być to...”
links.belarusian: "О так, вядома. Гэта павінна быць гэта..."

links.title: Composure: "Outwardly, they both exude calm, bu..."
links.english: Outwardly, they both exude calm, but there's something disturbing about this thought to both of them.
links.polish: Z zewnątrz oboje wydają się spokojni, ale dla każdego z nich jest w tej myśli coś niepokojącego.
links.belarusian: Звонку абодва выглядаюць спакойна, але для кожнага з іх ёсць у гэтай думцы нешта трывожнае.

links.title: You: ""Maybe it's your twin brother?""
links.english: "Maybe it's your twin brother?"
links.polish: „Może to twój brat bliźniak?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, гэта твой брат-блізнюк?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can assure you, it's not my 'twi..."
links.english: "I can assure you, it's not my 'twin brother'. Though it certainly does *sound* like me..." The lieutenant seems to wince at the sound of his own voice.
links.polish: „Zapewniam, że to nie jest mój »brat bliźniak«. Chociaż z pewnością *brzmi* to jak ja...” – porucznik zdaje się wzdragać na dźwięk własnego głosu.
links.belarusian: "Запэўніваю, што гэта не мой "брат-блізнюк". Хоць, безумоўна, *гучыць* гэта як я..." – лейтэнант, здаецца, здрыгануўся ад гучання ўласнага голасу.

links.title: You: ""What are you talking about, Kim? I..."
links.english: "What are you talking about, Kim? It's perfectly nice out."
links.polish: „O czym ty mówisz, Kim? Przecież jest piękna pogoda”.
links.belarusian: "Пра што ты кажаш, Кім? Ж надвор'е выдатнае".

links.title: You: ""It's really coming down, now that..."
links.english: "It's really coming down, now that you mention it."
links.polish: „Faktycznie robi się zimno, tak jak wspominasz”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды, становіцца халодна, як ты і згадваеш".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mention what?""
links.english: "Mention what?"
links.polish: „O czym wspomniałem?”
links.belarusian: "Пра што я ўзгадаў?"

links.title: You: ""It's cold, like you just said.""
links.english: "It's cold, like you just said."
links.polish: „Jest zimno, tak jak mówisz”.
links.belarusian: "Холадна, як ты кажаш".

links.title: Shivers: "A slight frisson at the point where..."
links.english: A slight frisson at the point where your neck meets your spine. You can *feel* the lieutenant's presence, even though he's nowhere to be found...
links.polish: Delikatny dreszcz w miejscu, gdzie kark łączy się z plecami. *Czujesz* w pobliżu obecność porucznika, choć próżno go tu szukać...
links.belarusian: Далікатны дрыжык у месцы, дзе шыя злучаецца са спінай. *Адчуваеш* побач прысутнасць лейтэнанта, хоць дарэмна яго тут шукаць...

links.title: You: ""Kim? How did you get on my connect..."
links.english: "Kim? How did you get on my connection?"
links.polish: „Kim? Jak ty się wciąłeś w moje połączenie?”
links.belarusian: "Кім? Як ты падключыўся да майго званка?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There's no way the lieutenant has..."
links.english: "There's no way the lieutenant has his *own* mega-low frequency connection. Very strange..."
links.polish: „Nie ma możliwości, żeby porucznik posiadał *własne* połączenie w meganiskim zakresie częstotliwości. Bardzo to dziwne...”
links.belarusian: "Няма магчымасці, каб лейтэнант меў *сваю ўласную* сувязь у мега-нізкім дыяпазоне частот. Вельмі дзіўна гэта..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Kim Kitsuragi: ""...someone has been maintaining it..."
links.english: "...someone has been maintaining it. The wiring has been repaired..."
links.polish: „...ktoś go serwisował. Okablowanie było naprawiane...”
links.belarusian: "...хтось яго абслугоўваў. Праводка была адрамантаваная..."

links.title: You: ""What is he talking about?""
links.english: "What is he talking about?"
links.polish: „O czym on mówi?”
links.belarusian: "Пра што ён кажа?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I believe you mean, what *was* he..."
links.english: "I believe you mean, what *was* he talking about."
links.polish: „O czym *mówił*, chciałeś powiedzieć”.
links.belarusian: "Аб чым *гаварыў*, ты хацеў сказаць".

links.title: You: ""Are you saying this is more entrop..."
links.english: "Are you saying this is more entroponetic crosstalk, then?"
links.polish: „Czyli twierdzisz, że to znowu jest entroponetyczny przesłuch?”
links.belarusian: "То бок ты сцвярджаеш, што гэта зноў энтрапанетычны допыт?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, that's by far the most likely..."
links.english: "Yes, that's by far the most likely explanation. But the odds of us hearing him, though, out of all the voices in the pale..."
links.polish: „Tak, to najbardziej prawdopodobne wyjaśnienie. Ale szanse na to, że spośród wszystkich głosów w szarocie usłyszymy właśnie jego...”
links.belarusian: "Так, гэта самае верагоднае тлумачэнне. Але шанцы на тое, што сярод усіх галасоў у шэрасьці мы пачуем менавіта яго..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's been a long winter... Long an..."
links.english: "It's been a long winter... Long and cold."
links.polish: „To była długa zima... Długa i zimna...”
links.belarusian: "Гэта была доўгая зіма... Доўгая і халодная..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""...are astronomically low.""
links.english: "...are astronomically low."
links.polish: „...są astronomicznie niskie”.
links.belarusian: "...з'яўляюцца астранамічна нізкімі".

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Natürlich halten ihn die Psycholog..."
links.english: "Natürlich halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal..."
links.polish: „Natürlich halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal...”
links.belarusian: "Natürlich halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal..."

links.title: You: ""Roy said this transceiver came wit..."
links.english: "Roy said this transceiver came with some kind of *signal purifier*. Maybe we should turn that on?"
links.polish: „Roy mówił, że jego transiwer miał jakiś *oczyszczacz sygnału*. Może powinniśmy go włączyć?”
links.belarusian: "Рой казаў, што яго трансівер меў нейкі *ачышчальнік сігналу*. Можа, нам варта яго ўключыць?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah! Very good thinking. I'll engag..."
links.english: "Ah! Very good thinking. I'll engage it now..."
links.polish: „Ach! Bardzo rozsądnie. Zaraz go włączę”.
links.belarusian: "Ах! Вельмі разумна. Зараз яго ўключу".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... someone has been maintaining i..."
links.english: "... someone has been maintaining it..." The lieutenant's voice suddenly grows faint and distant, as though he were speaking from a passing motor carriage...
links.polish: „...ktoś go serwisował...” – nagle głos porucznika stopniowo cichnie i oddala się, jakby dochodził z przejeżdżającego obok powozu motorowego...
links.belarusian: "...хтось яго абслугоўваў..." — раптам голас лейтэнанта паступова ціхне і аддаляецца, быццам чуецца з праязджаючага побач аўтамабіля...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's much better. Please, try ag..."
links.english: "That's much better. Please, try again."
links.polish: „O wiele lepiej. Spróbuj jeszcze raz, proszę”.
links.belarusian: "Значна лепш. Паспрабуй яшчэ раз, калі ласка".

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer. Do you a..."
links.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. Do you acknowledge? This is Firewalker."
links.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Potwierdzacie odbiór? Tu Ognisty”.
links.belarusian: "Вайсковы карабель кааліцыі "Лучнік". Пацвярджаеце прыём? Тут "Агністы"."

Alternate1.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. Do you acknowledge? This is Tequila Sunset."
Alternate1.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Potwierdzacie odbiór? Tu Tequila Sunset”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Вайсковы карабель Кааліцыі «Лучнік». Ці пацвярджаеце атрыманне? Тут Tequila Sunset».

Alternate2.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. Do you acknowledge? This is Detective Costeau."
Alternate2.polish: (Westchnij). „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Potwierdzacie odbiór? Tu detektyw Costeau”.
Alternate2.belarusian: (Вздыхнуў). «Ваенны Карабель Кааліцыі "Лучнік". Пацвярджаеце прыём? Тут дэтэктыў Коста».

Alternate3.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. Do you acknowledge? This is Lieutenant Du Bois."
Alternate3.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Potwierdzacie odbiór? Tu porucznik Du Bois”.
Alternate3.belarusian: «Карабель Вайсковай Кааліцыі „Лукнік”. Ці пацвярджаеце прыём? Тут лейтэнант Дзю Буа».

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Horseback Antenna: ""... Warship Archer. Are you there,..."
links.english: "... Warship Archer. Are you there, Firewalker? Please acknowledge."
links.polish: „…Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Jesteś tam, Ognisty? Potwierdź odbiór”.
links.belarusian: "…Ваенны Кааліцыі Лучнік. Ты там, Агністы? Пацвердзі прыём."

Alternate1.english: "... Warship Archer. Are you there, Tequila Sunset? Please acknowledge."
Alternate1.polish: „…Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Jesteś tam, Tequila Sunset? Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «…Вайсковы Кааліцыі Лукавік. Ты там, Тэкіла Сынсет? Пацвердзі прыём».

Alternate2.english: "... Warship Archer. Are you there, Detective Costeau? Please acknowledge."
Alternate2.polish: „…Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Jesteś tam, detektywie Costeau? Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate2.belarusian: «…Вайсковая Кааліцыя Лучнік. Вы там, дэтэктыў Косто? Пацвердзіце прыём».

Alternate3.english: "... Warship Archer. Are you there, Lieutenant Du Bois? Please acknowledge."
Alternate3.polish: „…Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Jesteś tam, poruczniku Du Bois? Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate3.belarusian: «…Вайсковая Кааліцыя Лука. Вы там, лейтэнант Дзю Буа? Пацвердзіце прыём».

links.title: You: ""Archer! This is Firewalker. Can yo..."
links.english: "Archer! This is Firewalker. Can you hear me?"
links.polish: „Łucznik! Tu Ognisty. Słyszycie mnie?”
links.belarusian: "Лучнік! Тут Агністы. Чуеце мяне?"

Alternate1.english: "Archer! This is Tequila Sunset. Can you hear me?"
Alternate1.polish: „Łucznik! Tu Tequila Sunset. Słyszycie mnie?”
Alternate1.belarusian: «Лучнік! Тут Тэкіла Сансет. Чуеце мяне?»

Alternate2.english: "Archer! This is Detective Costeau. Can you hear me?"

Alternate3.english: "Archer! This is Lieutenant Du Bois. Can you hear me?"
Alternate3.polish: „Łucznik! Tu porucznik Du Bois. Słyszycie mnie?”
Alternate3.belarusian: «Стралок! Тут лейтэнант Дзю Буа. Ці чуеце мяне?»

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Soona, the Programmer: ""Damn..." The programmer removes he..."
links.english: "Damn..." The programmer removes her sweat-drenched headphones. "Even with the crosstalk suppressed the signal is still very weak."
links.polish: „Cholera...” – programistka zdejmuje zapocone słuchawki. „Nawet po stłumieniu przesłuchu sygnał jest wciąż bardzo słaby”.
links.belarusian: "Холера..." — праграмістка здымае запатнелыя навушнікі. "Нават пасля падаўлення перашкод сігнал усё роўна вельмі слабы".

links.title: You: ""What can we do?""
links.english: "What can we do?"
links.polish: „Co możemy zrobić?”
links.belarusian: "Што мы можам зрабіць?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I did not expect simply locating t..."
links.english: "I did not expect simply locating the signal to be so difficult." She appears to be concentrating very intently.
links.polish: „Nie spodziewałam się, że już samo zlokalizowanie sygnału będzie takie trudne” – wydaje się bardzo mocno koncentrować.
links.belarusian: "Не чакала, што ўжо само выяўленне сігналу будзе такім складаным" — здаецца, вельмі моцна засяроджваецца.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We must consider several variables..."
links.english: "We must consider several variables: local entroponetic conditions, the sophistication of our transceiver, the quality of our connections, and the physics of our antenna itself."
links.polish: „Musimy rozważyć szereg zmiennych: lokalne warunki entroponetyczne, złożoność naszego transiwera, jakość naszych łączeń i fizykę samej anteny”.
links.belarusian: "Мы павінны разгледзець шэраг зменных: мясцовыя энтрапаметрычныя ўмовы, складанасць нашага трансіўэра, якасць нашых злучэнняў і фізіку самой антэны".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Fortunately, we have a more-than-a..."
links.english: "Fortunately, we have a more-than-adequate transceiver, so I do not believe it is causing any problems..."
links.polish: „Szczęśliwie nasz transiwer jest więcej niż wystarczający, nie sądzę więc, żeby powodował jakiekolwiek problemy...”
links.belarusian: "На шчасце, наш трансівер больш чым дастатковы, таму я не думаю, што ён выкліча якія-небудзь праблемы..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And we're also unlikely to change..."
links.english: "And we're also unlikely to change our local entroponetic conditions. So the next step is to thoroughly inspect our connections."
links.polish: „Zmiana warunków entroponetycznych jest za to dla nas raczej niemożliwa. Kolejny krok to w takim razie sprawdzenie łączeń”.
links.belarusian: "Змяненне ўмоў энтрапанетычных для нас хутчэй немагчымае. Наступны крок — праверка злучэнняў".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Our transceiver is perfectly capab..."
links.english: "Our transceiver is perfectly capable, so there is no problem there..."
links.polish: „Nasz transiwer jest jak najbardziej dobry, więc z tym nie ma problemu...”
links.belarusian: "Наш трансівер зусім добры, таму з гэтым няма праблемы..."

links.title: You: ""How am I supposed to inspect the c..."
links.english: "How am I supposed to inspect the connections?"
links.polish: „Jak mam dokładnie sprawdzić te łączenia?”
links.belarusian: "Як я магу дакладна праверыць гэтыя злучэнні?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You need to climb up there and loo..."
links.english: "You need to climb up there and look at them for yourself." She stares at you as though it were obvious. Her hand gestures to the colourful cables dangling from the horse's forehooves.
links.polish: „Musisz się tam wspiąć i sam się im przyjrzeć” – spogląda na ciebie, jakby było to oczywiste. Ręką wskazuje kolorowe kable zwisające z przednich kopyt konia.
links.belarusian: "Ты павінен туды ўскараскацца і сам на іх паглядзець", — глядзіць на цябе, як быццам гэта само сабой зразумела. Рукой паказвае на каляровыя кабелі, якія звісаюць з пярэдніх капытоў каня.

links.title: Logic: "But you don't have the technical ex..."
links.english: But you don't have the technical expertise...
links.polish: Ale nie masz odpowiedniej technicznej wiedzy...
links.belarusian: Але ў цябе няма адпаведных тэхнічных ведаў...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... someone has been maintaining i..."
links.english: "... someone has been maintaining it..."
links.polish: „...ktoś go serwisował...”
links.belarusian: "...хтосьці яго абслугоўваў..."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No problem at all. You've already t..."
links.english: No problem at all. You've already teleported up *way* greater heights.
links.polish: Żaden problem. Teleportowałeś się już w *o wiele* wyższe miejsca.
links.belarusian: Няма ніякай праблемы. Ты ўжо тэлепартаваўся ў *значна* больш высокія месцы.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Come on, son. This isn't anything b..."
links.english: Come on, son. This isn't anything but a common high bar! Just get a solid overhand grip and hoist yourself up!
links.polish: No dalej, synku. To nic innego niż zwykły drążek! Złap mocno nachwytem i się podciągnij!
links.belarusian: Ну давай, сынок. Гэта не што іншае, як звычайная перакладзіна! Захапі моцна зверху і падцягніся!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Images of your body smashed against..."
links.english: Images of your body smashed against the pavement flood your mind -- this is *dangerous*.
links.polish: Przez umysł przebiegają ci obrazy twojego roztrzaskanego o bruk ciała. To *niebezpieczne*.
links.belarusian: Праз розум прабягаюць карціны твайго цела, разбітага аб брук. Гэта *небяспечна*.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Something about this set-up seems d..."
links.english: Something about this set-up seems dimly familiar, but you'll be damned if you know what you're supposed to do about it.
links.polish: Coś w tej konfiguracji wydaje ci się dziwnie znajome, ale prędzej cię skręci, niż dojdziesz, co właściwie powinieneś z nią zrobić.
links.belarusian: Нешта ў гэтай канфігурацыі здаецца табе дзіўна знаёмым, але хутчэй табе будзе цяжка, чым ты зразумееш, што насамрэч павінен з гэтым зрабіць.

links.title: You: ""But I don't know what I'm doing...""
links.english: "But I don't know what I'm doing..."
links.polish: „Ale ja nie wiem, co robię...”
links.belarusian: "Але я не ведаю, што я раблю..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's true, but I can't leave my..."
links.english: "That's true, but I can't leave my station, so it will have to be you."
links.polish: „To prawda, ale ja nie mogę opuścić swojego stanowiska, więc musisz to zrobić ty”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта праўда, але я не магу пакінуць сваё месца, таму ты павінен гэта зрабіць".

links.title: You: ""No problem. I've already mastered..."
links.english: "No problem. I've already mastered the art of teleportation."
links.polish: „Żaden problem. Opanowałem już sztukę teleportacji”.
links.belarusian: "Ніякай праблемы. Я ўжо авалодаў мастацтвам тэлепартацыі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You actually haven't. But you have..."
links.english: "You actually haven't. But you have proven that you're a relatively capable climber."
links.polish: „Nie opanowałeś teleportacji. Ale udowodniłeś, że jest z ciebie stosunkowo sprawny wspinacz”.
links.belarusian: "Ты не асвоіў тэлеportацыю. Але даказаў, што ты адносна спрытны альпініст".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Teleportation isn't real. Climbing..."
links.english: "Teleportation isn't real. Climbing is, however. With all its hazards."
links.polish: „Teleportacja nie istnieje naprawdę. Ale wspinaczka tak. Związane z nią zagrożenia też”.
links.belarusian: "Тэлепартацыя не існуе насамрэч. Але альпінізм існуе. Створаныя ім рызыкі таксама".

links.title: You: ""But what if I slip and fall...""
links.english: "But what if I slip and fall..."
links.polish: „Ale co jeśli pośliznę się i spadnę...?”
links.belarusian: "Але што, калі я паслізнуся і ўпаў...?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then you might break your neck," s..."
links.english: "Then you might break your neck," she replies matter-of-factly.
links.polish: „Wtedy możesz skręcić kark” – odpowiada rzeczowo.
links.belarusian: "Тады можаш зламаць шыю", — адказвае ён стрымана.

links.title: You: ""Okay, let's do this." (Climb the m..."
links.english: "Okay, let's do this." (Climb the monument.)
links.polish: „Dobrze, do dzieła”. (Wejdź na pomnik).
links.belarusian: "Добра, да справы". (Узыйдзі на помнік).

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Your gloves give you a solid grip o..."
links.english: Your gloves give you a solid grip on the metal bar. This feels pleasingly familiar...
links.polish: Rękawiczki zapewniają ci pewny chwyt na metalowym pręcie. To dziwnie przyjemne i znajome uczucie...
links.belarusian: Пальчаткі забяспечваюць вам надзейны захоп на металічным пруце. Гэта дзіўна прыемнае і знаёмае адчуванне...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Keep it together, champ! You've *go..."
links.english: Keep it together, champ! You've *got* this.
links.polish: Trzymaj się w garści, szefie! *Dasz radę*.
links.belarusian: Трымайся ў руках, начальнік! *Ты справішся*.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "... and before you know it, you're..."
links.english: ... and before you know it, you're safely perched atop the monument.
links.polish: ...a po krótkiej chwili siedzisz już bezpiecznie na szczycie pomnika.
links.belarusian: ...а праз кароткі час ты ўжо бяспечна сядзіш на вяршыні помніка.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The metal bar is cold and slick wit..."
links.english: The metal bar is cold and slick with precipitation. For a moment it feels as though you're about to slip, but you concentrate all your attention on your pectoral muscles and squeeze...
links.polish: Metalowy pręt jest zimny i śliski od deszczu. Przez moment masz wrażenie, że się ześlizgniesz, skupiasz jednak całą swoją uwagę na mięśniach piersiowych i ściskasz...
links.belarusian: Металічны прут халодны і слізкі ад дажджу. На імгненне ў цябе ўзнікае адчуванне, што ты саслізнеш, але засяроджваеш усю сваю ўвагу на грудных мышцах і сціскаеш...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Don't forget the lats, champ! You'v..."
links.english: Don't forget the lats, champ! You've *got* this.
links.polish: Nie zapomnij o mięśniach grzbietu, chłopie! *Dasz radę*.
links.belarusian: Не забудзь пра мышцы спіны, хлопец! *У цябе ўсё атрымаецца*.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The cold metal chills your bare han..."
links.english: The cold metal chills your bare hands. Some part of your brain tells you something is missing...
links.polish: Zimny metal mrozi twoje gołe ręce. Jakaś część mózgu podszeptuje ci, że czegoś tu brakuje...
links.belarusian: Халодны метал абмаражвае твае голыя рукі. Нейкая частка мозгу падказвае табе, што чагосьці тут не хапае...

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and..."
links.english: Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and keeps your grip firm.
links.polish: Magnezja. Pochłania wilgoć i zapewnia pewny chwyt.
links.belarusian: Магнезія. Убірае вільгаць і забяспечвае надзейны захоп.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "... but before you can decide what,..."
links.english: ... but before you can decide what, you find yourself safely perched atop the monument.
links.polish: ...zanim jednak dociera do ciebie, czego dokładnie, docierasz bezpiecznie na szczyt pomnika.
links.belarusian: ...але, перш чым зразумець дакладна, чаго, ты бяспечна дабіраешся да вяршыні помніка.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The cold metal chills your bare han..."
links.english: The cold metal chills your bare hands. Some part of your brain tells you something is missing...
links.polish: Zimny metal mrozi twoje gołe ręce. Jakaś część mózgu podszeptuje ci, że czegoś tu brakuje...
links.belarusian: Халодны метал марозіць твае голыя рукі. Нейкая частка мозгу падказвае табе, што тут чагосьці не хапае...

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and..."
links.english: Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and keeps your grip firm.
links.polish: Magnezja. Pochłania wilgoć i zapewnia pewny chwyt.
links.belarusian: Магнезія. Паглынае вільгаць і забяспечвае надзейнае счапленне.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "You don't exactly cut a lithesome f..."
links.english: You don't exactly cut a lithesome figure, but after several moments of scrambling you manage to hoist yourself atop the monument.
links.polish: Popisu zwinności raczej nie dajesz, ale po kilku chwilach wysiłku udaje ci się wspiąć na szczyt pomnika.
links.belarusian: Апісу гнуткасці хутчэй не даеш, але пасля некалькіх хвілін намаганняў табе ўдаецца ўзлезці на вяршыню помніка.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "That performance was, frankly, an e..."
links.english: That performance was, frankly, an embarrassment.
links.polish: Prawdę mówiąc, aż wstyd brał na sam widok.
links.belarusian: Сапраўды кажучы, нават сорам браў ад аднаго выгляду.

links.title: You: ""Did you *see* that bar work?""
links.english: "Did you *see* that bar work?"
links.polish: „*Widzieliście*, jak sobie poradziłem na tym drążku?”
links.belarusian: "*Бачылі*, як я справіўся на гэтай перакладзіне?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, you're a natural gymnast, det..."
links.english: "Yes, you're a natural gymnast, detective. Now would you like to do what you got up there to do?"
links.polish: „Tak, urodzony z ciebie gimnastyk, detektywie. Zajmiesz się teraz tym, po co się tam wdrapałeś?”
links.belarusian: "Так, ты прама натуральны гімнаст, дэтэктыве. Займешся цяпер тым, для чаго туды залез?"

Alternate1.english: "You're doing alright, detective. Just keep your focus on the task at hand."
Alternate1.polish: „Dobrze sobie radzisz, detektywie. Po prostu skup się na swoim zadaniu”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Добра спраўляешся, дэтэктыў. Проста засяродзься на сваёй задачы».

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I didn't see anything. I was focus..."
links.english: "I didn't see anything. I was focussed on my work. Have you checked the connections yet, or no?"
links.polish: „Nic nie widziałam. Byłam skupiona na pracy. Sprawdziłeś już te łączenia czy nie?”
links.belarusian: "Я нічога не бачыла. Я была засяроджана на працы. Ты ўжо праверыў гэтыя злучэнні ці не?"

links.title: You: ""That was pretty bad. I hope nobody..."
links.english: "That was pretty bad. I hope nobody saw it."
links.polish: „Nie wyglądało to dobrze. Mam nadzieję, że nikt nie widział”.
links.belarusian: "Не выглядала гэта добра. Спадзяюся, што ніхто не бачыў".

links.title: You: "Examine the connections."
links.english: Examine the connections.
links.polish: Przyjrzyj się łączeniom.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі на злучэнні.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The connection itself is nothing mo..."
links.english: The connection itself is nothing more than a little braid of exposed wire wrapped about the hoof of the horse, a copper fetter it cannot slip.
links.polish: Samo połączenie to tylko mała wiązka odsłoniętego przewodu owiniętego wokół podkowy konia, miedziane więzy, z których nie może się uwolnić.
links.belarusian: Само злучэнне — гэта толькі невялічкі пучок аголенага проваду, сматанага вакол падковы каня, медныя сувязі, ад якіх ён не можа вызваліцца.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The whole monument is covered in a..."
links.english: The whole monument is covered in a thin but durable layer of oil and grime. It's obvious no one has cleaned it in years.
links.polish: Cały pomnik pokryty jest cienką, lecz odporną warstwą tłuszczu i brudu. Widać od razu, że całe lata nie był czyszczony.
links.belarusian: Увесь помнік пакрыты тонкім, але ўстойлівым слоем тлушчу і бруду. Відно адразу, што цэлыя гады ён не чысціўся.

links.title: Logic: "The programmer mentioned ammonia, b..."
links.english: The programmer mentioned ammonia, but anything *alcoholic* should dissolve the oils, creating a cleaner (and clearer) connection.
links.polish: Programistka wspomniała o amoniaku, ale jakikolwiek *alkohol* też mógłby rozpuścić tłuszcz, oczyszczając łącze (i połączenie).
links.belarusian: Праграмістка згадала пра аміяк, але любы *спірт* таксама мог бы растварыць тлушч, ачысціўшы злучэнне (і сувязь).

links.title: You: "Pour some alcohol over the connecti..."
links.english: Pour some alcohol over the connections.
links.polish: Zalej łączenia odrobiną alkoholu.
links.belarusian: Залійце злучэнні крыху спірту.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "It takes a few moments, but the alc..."
links.english: It takes a few moments, but the alcohol gradually begins to break down the oils surrounding the copper wiring.
links.polish: Chwilę to zajmuje, ale alkohol zaczyna w końcu rozbijać oblepiający miedziane przewody tłuszcz.
links.belarusian: Гэта займае некаторы час, але спірт нарэшце пачынае разбіваць тлушч, які загартоўвае медныя правады.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is this really the time, detective?""
links.english: "Is this really the time, detective?"
links.polish: „Czy to odpowiednia pora na alkohol, detektywie?”
links.belarusian: "Ці гэта адпаведны час для алкаголю, дэтэктыве?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's alright, lieutenant. He's sim..."
links.english: "It's alright, lieutenant. He's simply cleaning the connections."
links.polish: „W porządku, poruczniku. On tylko czyści łączenia”.
links.belarusian: "У парадку, лейтэнант. Ён толькі чысціць злучэнні".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What are you doing?! Oh... cleanin..."
links.english: "What are you doing?! Oh... cleaning the connections? Smart."
links.polish: „Co ty robisz?! Och... Czyścisz łącza? Sprytnie”.
links.belarusian: "Што ты робіш?! Ох... Чысціш спасылкі? Хітра".

links.title: Electrochemistry: "More than that, you're sacrificing..."
links.english: More than that, you're sacrificing something precious on the altar...
links.polish: Co więcej, poświęcasz na tym ołtarzu coś drogocennego...
links.belarusian: Больш за тое, ты прыносіш на гэтым алтары нешта каштоўнае...

links.title: You: "Clean the connections with the ammo..."
links.english: Clean the connections with the ammonia.
links.polish: Oczyść łączenia amoniakiem.
links.belarusian: Ачысціце злучэнні аміякам.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Almost immediately, the ammonia beg..."
links.english: Almost immediately, the ammonia begins breaking down the oils around the copper wiring.
links.polish: Amoniak niemal natychmiast zaczyna rozbijać oblepiający miedziane przewody tłuszcz.
links.belarusian: Аміяк амаль імгненна пачынае разбіваць тлушч, які абляпляе медныя правады.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Glad that stuff came in handy afte..."
links.english: "Glad that stuff came in handy after all..."
links.polish: „Cieszę się, że jednak do czegoś się to przydało...”
links.belarusian: "Радуюся, што гэта ўсё ж такі спатрэбілася..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah. Very good, officer.""
links.english: "Ah. Very good, officer."
links.polish: „Ach. Doskonale!”
links.belarusian: "Ах. Выдатна!"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Once the oils have been dissolved,..."
links.english: Once the oils have been dissolved, you wipe off the connections with your sleeve and reattach the cable.
links.polish: Czekasz chwilę, aż tłuszcz się rozpuści, po czym wycierasz pręt rękawem i podpinasz kabel ponownie.
links.belarusian: Чакаеш момант, пакуль тлушч не растане, затым выціраеш стрыжань рукавом і зноў падключаеш кабель.

links.title: You: ""Did that help?""
links.english: "Did that help?"
links.polish: „Czy to pomogło?”
links.belarusian: "Ці гэта дапамагло?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Hmm, I had hoped that between the..."
links.english: "Hmm, I had hoped that between the signal purifier and cleaning the connections that we would have it, but perhaps I overestimated."
links.polish: „Hmm, miałam nadzieję, że użycie oczyszczacza sygnału i przemycie łączeń załatwi sprawę, ale chyba za wiele oczekiwałam”.
links.belarusian: "Гм, я спадзявалася, што выкарыстанне ачышчальніка сігналу і прамыванне злучэнняў вырашыць праблему, але, мабыць, я занадта шмат чакала".

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""... unser einziges Kind. Er kann d..."
links.english: "... unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen..."
links.polish: „...unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen...”
links.belarusian: "... unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Hmm, it seems to have made some di..."
links.english: "Hmm, it seems to have made some difference, but unfortunately not enough to alter the overall situation."
links.polish: „Hmm, trochę to chyba pomogło, ale niestety – za mało, żeby zmienić ogólną sytuację”.
links.belarusian: "Хмм, крыху гэта, напэўна, дапамагло, але, на жаль, - недастаткова, каб змяніць агульную сітуацыю".

links.title: Logic: "If you had something *alcoholic*, y..."
links.english: If you had something *alcoholic*, you could dissolve the oils, creating a cleaner (and clearer) connection.
links.polish: Gdybyś miał jakiś *alkohol*, mógłbyś rozpuścić tłuszcz, oczyszczając łącze (i połączenie).
links.belarusian: Калі б у цябе быў нейкі *алкаголь*, ты мог бы растварыць тлушч, ачысціўшы сувязь (і злучэнне).

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Truth be told, you have no idea wha..."
links.english: Truth be told, you have no idea what you're looking for. It just looks like a cord attached to a piece of metal. You pick at the colourful rubber jacketing, not sure what else to do...
links.polish: Prawdę mówiąc, nie masz nawet pojęcia, czego szukasz. Wygląda to jak zwykły kabel podłączony do kawałka metalu. Skubiesz kolorową izolację, nie wiedząc, co innego możesz zrobić...
links.belarusian: Сапраўды кажучы, ты нават паняцця не маеш, чаго шукаеш. Гэта выглядае як звычайны кабель, падключаны да кавалка металу. Ты ўзломваеш каляровую ізаляцыю, не ведаючы, што яшчэ можна зрабіць...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Well, do you see anything?""
links.english: "Well, do you see anything?"
links.polish: „I jak? Widzisz coś?”
links.belarusian: "І як? Бачыш нешта?"

links.title: You: ""The whole statue's covered in weir..."
links.english: "The whole statue's covered in weird oils. I don't think it's good for the connections."
links.polish: „Cały ten pomnik jest pokryty jakimś dziwnym tłuszczem. Chyba nie robi to dobrze łączeniom”.
links.belarusian: "Увесь гэты помнік пакрыты нейкім дзіўным тлушчам. Здаецца, гэта не ідзе на карысць злучэнням".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Damn, I was afraid of that. And I..."
links.english: "Damn, I was afraid of that. And I didn't bring any solvents with me. How foolish..."
links.polish: „Cholera, tego się obawiałam. A wzięłam żadnego rozpuszczalnika. Co za bezmyślność...”
links.belarusian: "Чорт, гэтага я і баялася. А я не ўзяла растваральніка. Якая бяздумнасць..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Short of changing the shape of the..."
links.english: "Short of changing the shape of the antenna, I'm not sure what else we can do from here. And the lorries are all jammed together, so that's unlikely to happen."
links.polish: „Pomijając zmianę kształtu anteny, niewiele chyba możemy tu zdziałać. A ciężarówki są mocno ściśnięte, więc nie bardzo może być o tym mowa”.
links.belarusian: "За выняткам змены формы антэны, наўрад ці мы можам тут шмат зрабіць. А грузавікі вельмі шчыльна сціснутыя, таму пра гэта цяжка гаварыць".

links.title: You: ""What would changing the shape of t..."
links.english: "What would changing the shape of the antenna do?"
links.polish: „Co dałaby zmiana kształtu anteny?”
links.belarusian: "Што б дало змяненне формы антэны?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ideally, narrow the receiving mode..."
links.english: "Ideally, narrow the receiving mode, so that we can isolate the warship's signal and eliminate the crosstalk. But if you don't know what you're doing of course you could just make it worse."
links.polish: „W najlepszym razie zawęzi pasmo odbioru, co pozwoli wyizolować sygnał okrętu i wyeliminować przesłuch. Ale jeśli nie wiesz, co robisz, możesz też, oczywiście, pogorszyć sprawę”.
links.belarusian: "У найлепшым выпадку гэта звузіць паласу прыёму, што дазволіць ізаляваць сігнал карабля і паменшыць перашкоды. Але калі ты не ведаеш, што робіш, то, вядома, можаш і пагоршыць сітуацыю".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She sighs. "I'm afraid we're out of..."
links.english: She sighs. "I'm afraid we're out of alternatives. You're just going to have to *go for it*."
links.polish: Wzdycha. „Obawiam się, że nie mamy już alternatyw. Będziesz musiał po prostu *spróbować*”.
links.belarusian: Уздыхае. "Баюся, што ў нас больш няма альтэрнатыў. Табе проста давядзецца *паспрабаваць*".

links.title: Empathy: "She's right. The responsibility is..."
links.english: She's right. The responsibility is yours and yours alone. There's no turning back now.
links.polish: Ma rację. To twoja i tylko twoja odpowiedzialność. Nie ma już odwrotu.
links.belarusian: Ён мае рацыю. Гэта твая і толькі твая адказнасць. Вяртання ўжо няма.

links.title: You: "Look at the rider."
links.english: Look at the rider.
links.polish: Spójrz na jeźdźca.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі на вершніка.

Alternate1.english: Look at Filippe III.
Alternate1.polish: Spójrz na Filipa III.
Alternate1.belarusian: Паглядзі на Філіпа III.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "You are face to face with Filippe I..."
links.english: You are face to face with Filippe III. The bronze king looks toward the west. Something about his features seems bizarrely distorted.
links.polish: Oto jesteś twarzą w twarz z Filipem III. Brązowy król spogląda na zachód. Coś w jego rysach twarzy wydaje się dziwacznie zniekształcone.
links.belarusian: Вось вы стаіце тварам да твару з Філіпам III. Бронзавы кароль глядзіць на захад. Штосьці ў яго рысах твару здаецца дзіўна скажоным.

links.title: Logic: "Not intentionally. It’s a matter of..."
links.english: Not intentionally. It’s a matter of perspective. The king was never meant to be seen from such an angle as you’ve attained.
links.polish: Nie jest to zamierzone – kwestia perspektywy. Król nie miał być nigdy oglądany pod kątem, pod jakim obecnie siedzisz.
links.belarusian: Гэта не наўмысна – пытанне перспектывы. Кароль ніколі не быў прызначаны для прагляду пад вуглом, пад якім ты зараз сядзіш.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "His imperious gaze leads you natura..."
links.english: His imperious gaze leads you naturally to his outstretched hand, which for some reason strikes you as sadly empty...
links.polish: Jego władczy wzrok nakazuje ci spojrzeć na jego wyciągniętą rękę, która z jakiegoś powodu wydaje ci się smutno pusta...
links.belarusian: Яго ўладны позірк прымушае цябе зірнуць на ягоную выцягнутую руку, якая па нейкай прычыне здаецца табе сумна пустой...

links.title: Endurance: "He seems ill-equipped for wherever..."
links.english: He seems ill-equipped for wherever he’s going. A king should not go about unarmed.
links.polish: Wygląda na nieprzygotowanego na podróż, gdziekolwiek się wybiera. Król nie powinien pozostawać nieuzbrojony.
links.belarusian: Выглядае, што ён не падрыхтаваны да падарожжа, куды б ён ні накіроўваўся. Кароль не павінен заставацца незбройным.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You can't help but feel that *sabre..."
links.english: You can't help but feel that *sabre* you picked up might just give this old king a little more panache *and* better reception!
links.polish: Nie potrafisz pozbyć się myśli, że ta *szabla*, którą masz, mogłaby dodać królowi nieco animuszu, a *przy okazji* poprawić odbiór!
links.belarusian: Вы не можаце пазбавіцца думкі, што гэтая *шабля*, якую ў вас ёсць, магла б дадаць каралю крыху адвагі, а *заадно* палепшыць успрыманне!

links.title: Conceptualization: "Come on! Kings and sabres are so *p..."
links.english: Come on! Kings and sabres are so *played out*. There's a *better* way...
links.polish: No daj spokój! Królowie i szable to już taki *przeżytek*. Musi być *lepszy* sposób...
links.belarusian: Ну даволі! Каралі і шаблі - гэта ўжо такі *перажытак*. Павінен быць *лепшы* спосаб...

links.title: You: "Wait, what's this "better way"?"
links.english: Wait, what's this "better way"?
links.polish: Chwila. Jaki jest ten niby lepszy sposób?
links.belarusian: Момант. Які гэты, нібыта, лепшы спосаб?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Why not arm the good king's valiant..."
links.english: Why not arm the good king's valiant steed instead? There seems to be *just* enough room between its teeth there...
links.polish: Czemu by nie uzbroić raczej mężnego królewskiego wierzchowca? Zdaje się, że między rzędami zębów ma *akurat dość* miejsca...
links.belarusian: Чаму б не ўзброіць хутчэй адважнага каралеўскага каня? Здаецца, што паміж радамі зубоў у яго *якраз дастаткова* месца...

links.title: You: "That's brilliant! [Put the sabre be..."
links.english: That's brilliant! [Put the sabre between the horse's teeth.]
links.polish: Genialne! (Wsadź szablę w końskie zęby).
links.belarusian: Геніяльна! (Усунь шаблю ў конскія зубы).

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "To your surprise, the sabre slides..."
links.english: To your surprise, the sabre slides snugly between the horse's bared teeth.
links.polish: Ku twojemu zaskoczeniu, szabla swobodnie wślizguje się między odsłonięte końskie zęby.
links.belarusian: Да твайго здзіўлення, шабля свабодна слізгае паміж аголенымі конскімі зубамі.

links.title: You: "That's a little *too* out there. [P..."
links.english: That's a little *too* out there. [Put the sabre in the king's hand.]
links.polish: To chyba trochę *zbyt* odjechane. (Wsadź szablę w królewską rękę).
links.belarusian: Гэта, напэўна, трохі *занадта* экстравагантна. (Усунь шаблю ў каралеўскую руку).

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.english: Keep it to yourself.
links.polish: Zatrzymaj ją.
links.belarusian: Спыні яе.

links.title: You: "Attach the sabre."
links.english: Attach the sabre.
links.polish: Zamocuj szablę.
links.belarusian: Замацуй шаблю.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "To your surprise, the sabre's hilt..."
links.english: To your surprise, the sabre's hilt fits quite snugly in the statue's hand. The king cuts quite the triumphal figure now.
links.polish: Ku twojemu zaskoczeniu rękojeść szabli całkiem dobrze pasuje do dłoni pomnika. Poza króla wydaje się teraz całkiem tryumfalna.
links.belarusian: Да вашай здзіўленасці, ручка шаблі даволі добра падыходзіць да рукі помніка. Поза караля зараз здаецца даволі трыумфальнай.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There is no way *that* is going to..."
links.english: "There is no way *that* is going to make any difference..."
links.polish: „Nie ma mowy, żeby *to* cokolwiek zmieniło...”
links.belarusian: "Няма гаворкі, каб *гэта* што-небудзь змяніла..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's making a very *slight* differ..."
links.english: "It's making a very *slight* difference. The signal is a bit clearer than it was."
links.polish: „*Odrobinę* to zmienia. Sygnał jest teraz nieco wyraźniejszy”.
links.belarusian: "*Немножачка* гэта змяняе. Сігнал цяпер крыху выразнейшы".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Huh. The signal is coming through..."
links.english: "Huh. The signal is coming through a bit clearer now. Good work."
links.polish: „O. Sygnał stał się nieco wyraźniejszy. Dobra robota”.
links.belarusian: "О. Сігнал стаў крыху выразнейшым. Добрая праца".

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.english: Keep it to yourself.
links.polish: Zatrzymaj ją.
links.belarusian: Спыні яе.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The king won't know what he's missi..."
links.english: The king won't know what he's missing. He stares straight ahead, his expression defiant and verdigris.
links.polish: Król nawet nie zorientuje się, co traci. Patrzy prosto przed siebie z wojowniczą, zaśniedziałą twarzą.
links.belarusian: Кароль нават не зразумее, што губляе. Глядзіць прама перад сабой з ваяўнічым, зісталым тварам.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything in order, detective? Yo..."
links.english: "Everything in order, detective? You're really giving Filippe III a stare."
links.polish: „Wszystko w porządku, detektywie? Srogo wpatrujesz się w tego Filipa III”.
links.belarusian: "Усё ў парадку, дэтэктыве? Строга ўглядаешся ў гэтага Філіпа III".

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Are you alright, officer?""
links.english: "Are you alright, officer?"
links.polish: „Wszystko dobrze?”
links.belarusian: "Усё добра?"

links.title: You: "Look at the horse."
links.english: Look at the horse.
links.polish: Spójrz na konia.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі на каня.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "This faithful steed cuts a dashing..."
links.english: This faithful steed cuts a dashing figure with the replica sabre between its teeth.
links.polish: Wierny rumak wygląda przewspaniale z repliką szabli w zębach.
links.belarusian: Верны конь выглядае цудоўна з копіям шаблі ў зубах.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "This faithful steed is in nearly as..."
links.english: This faithful steed is in nearly as poor a condition as its rider.
links.polish: Ten wierny rumak jest w niemal równie fatalnym stanie co jeździec.
links.belarusian: Гэты верны конь знаходзіцца ў амаль такім жа жаласным стане, як і вершнік.

links.title: You: "Look up."
links.english: Look up.
links.polish: Spójrz w górę.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі ўверх.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A clear sky. The kind of day where..."
links.english: A clear sky. The kind of day where anything might happen...
links.polish: Czyste niebo. Dzień z rodzaju tych, w które wszystko może się stać...
links.belarusian: Чыстае неба. Дзень з тых, у якія ўсё можа здарыцца...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Across the river, you can see Coali..."
links.english: Across the river, you can see Coalition Warship Archer tracing its gradual circuit above Revachol East.
links.polish: Za rzeką widzisz kreślący powolne koło nad Wschodnim Revacholem Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik.
links.belarusian: За ракой бачыш, як над Усходнім Рэвашолем павольна апісвае круг Карабель Вайсковай Кааліцыі "Лучнік".

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The sky is gray and overcast. Someh..."
links.english: The sky is gray and overcast. Somehow, the raindrops seem to fall more slowly from this angle...
links.polish: Niebo jest szare i zachmurzone. Z tej perspektywy krople deszczu wydają się z jakiegoś powodu spadać wolniej...
links.belarusian: Неба шэрае і пахмурнае. З гэтай перспектывы кроплі дажджу здаюцца па нейкай прычыне падаючымі павольней...

Alternate1.english: The sky is gray and overcast. Snow spirals all around you...
Alternate1.polish: Niebo jest szare i zachmurzone. Śnieg wiruje wokół ciebie...
Alternate1.belarusian: Неба шэрае і зацягнутае хмарамі. Снег віруе вакол цябе...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Through the scrim, you can just mak..."
links.english: Through the scrim, you can just make out the shadow of Coalition Warship Archer a few kilometres to the east.
links.polish: Przez ten woal dostrzegasz cień unoszącego się kilka kilometrów na wschód Okrętu Wojennego Koalicji Łucznik.
links.belarusian: Праз гэты вэлюм ты заўважаеш цень, якая ўзнімаецца на некалькі кіламетраў на ўсход ад Вайсковага Карабля Кааліцыі Лучнік.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A clear night sky. The stars make f..."
links.english: A clear night sky. The stars make for a brilliant display...
links.polish: Czyste nocne niebo. Gwiazdy dają wspaniały pokaz...
links.belarusian: Чыстае начное неба. Зоркі даюць цудоўнае відовішча...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Across the river, you can see the l..."
links.english: Across the river, you can see the lights of Coalition Warship Archer floating above Revachol East.
links.polish: Za rzeką widzisz światła unoszącego się nad Wschodnim Revacholem Okrętu Wojennego Koalicji Łucznik.
links.belarusian: За ракой ты бачыш агні, што плывуць над Усходнім Рэвашолем Карабля Вайсковай Кааліцыі "Лучнік".

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The sky is opaque with dark clouds...."
links.english: The sky is opaque with dark clouds. Somehow, the raindrops seem to fall more slowly from this angle...
links.polish: Niebo jest przesłonięte ciężkimi chmurami. Z tej perspektywy krople deszczu wydają się z jakiegoś powodu spadać wolniej...
links.belarusian: Неба заслонена цяжкімі аблокамі. З гэтай перспектывы кроплі дажджу здаюцца з нейкай прычыны падаюць павольней...

Alternate1.english: The sky is opaque with dark clouds. Snow spirals all around you...
Alternate1.polish: Niebo jest przesłonięte ciężkimi chmurami. Śnieg wiruje wokół ciebie...
Alternate1.belarusian: Неба пакрыта цяжкімі аблакамі. Снег віруе вакол цябе...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "You turn to the east, but the visib..."
links.english: You turn to the east, but the visibility is quite poor. You see no sign of Coalition Warship Archer, though you know it can't be too far away.
links.polish: Odwracasz się na wschód, ale widoczność nie jest dobra. Nie jesteś w stanie zauważyć Okrętu Wojennego Koalicji Łucznik, choć wiesz, że nie może być daleko.
links.belarusian: Паварочваешся на ўсход, але бачнасць не вельмі добрая. Ты не ў стане заўважыць Ваенны Корабль Кааліцыі "Лучнік", хоць ведаеш, што ён не можа быць далёка.

links.title: You: "Look down."
links.english: Look down.
links.polish: Spójrz w dół.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі ўніз.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A few of the idle lorry drivers and..."
links.english: A few of the idle lorry drivers and strike breakers gesture at you with their cigarettes, more out of curiosity than anything else. From the window of one of the adjacent apartment buildings, an older woman leans out, her heavy breasts sagging...
links.polish: Kilku bezczynnych kierowców ciężarówek wskazuje na ciebie papierosami, bardziej z ciekawości niż wielkiego zaskoczenia. Z okna jednego z pobliskich budynków mieszkalnych wychyla się starsza kobieta; jej pełne piersi ciągną ku ziemi...
links.belarusian: Некалькі бяздзейных кіроўцаў грузавікоў указваюць на цябе цыгарэтамі, больш з цікаўнасці, чым з вялікага здзіўлення. З акна аднаго з бліжніх жылых будынкаў выглядае старэйшая жанчына; яе поўныя грудзі цягнуцца да зямлі...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "She yells a single word you can't m..."
links.english: She yells a single word you can't make out, and then shuts the window with a violent *thunk*.
links.polish: Wykrzykuje jedno słowo, którego nie rozumiesz, po czym zamyka okno z głośnym *łup*.
links.belarusian: Ён крычыць адно слова, якога ты не разумееш, пасля чаго зачыняе акно з гучным *лёп*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Down below a little doll-sized lieu..."
links.english: Down below a little doll-sized lieutenant is looking up, shielding his eyes. He's worried for you.
links.polish: Na dole widzisz rozmiarów małej lalki porucznika – zasłania sobie oczy. Martwi się o ciebie.
links.belarusian: Унізе бачыш памеры маленькай лялькі лейтэнанта — закрывае вочы. Хвалюецца пра цябе.

links.title: You: "Attempt to narrow the receiving mod..."
links.english: Attempt to narrow the receiving mode manually.
links.polish: Spróbuj ręcznie zawęzić zakres trybu odbioru.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуйце ўручную звузіць дыяпазон рэжыму прыёму.

links.title: Interfacing: "Your grip is firm, yet controlled...."
links.english: Your grip is firm, yet controlled. The swelling in your headset guides your hands as much as your hands guide the bronze horse head. It's almost like you're hearing *through* the horse itself...
links.polish: Twój chwyt jest mocny, lecz kontrolowany. Szumy w twoich słuchawkach kierują twoimi rękami w takim samym stopniu, w jakim twoje ręce kierują brązową końską głową. To niemal jakbyś słyszał bezpośrednio *przez* konia...
links.belarusian: Твой захоп моцны, але кантраляваны. Шумы ў тваіх навушніках кіруюць тваімі рукамі ў такой жа ступені, у якой твае рукі кіруюць карычневай галавой каня. Гэта амаль як быццам ты чуў наўпрост *праз* каня...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's very good. Just a bit more..."
links.english: "That's very good. Just a bit more to the left..."
links.polish: „Bardzo dobrze. Jeszcze odrobinę w lewo...”
links.belarusian: "Вельмі добра. Яшчэ крыху налева..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""... Nein, Liebling!""
links.english: "... Nein, Liebling!"
links.polish: „...Nein, Liebling!”
links.belarusian: "... Nein, Liebling!"

links.title: Interfacing: "The signal is clear, the storm has..."
links.english: The signal is clear, the storm has passed. This is another voice, a live voice, on the other end of this invisible bridge you've established...
links.polish: Sygnał jest czysty, burza minęła. Po drugiej stronie zbudowanego przez ciebie niewidzialnego mostu słyszysz inny, żywy głos...
links.belarusian: Сігнал чысты, бура мінула. Па другую бок пабудаванага табою нябачнага моста чуеш іншы, жывы голас...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Try it now, officer.""
links.english: "Try it now, officer."
links.polish: „Spróbuj teraz”.
links.belarusian: "Паспрабуй цяпер".

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer. This is..."
links.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. This is RCM Officer Firewalker. Please acknowledge."
links.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Tu funkcjonariusz MOR-u, Ognisty. Potwierdź odbiór”.
links.belarusian: "Вайсковы карабель Кааліцыі "Лукнік". Тут службоўца РГМ, Агінсты. Пацвердзіце атрыманне".

Alternate1.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. This is RCM Officer Tequila Sunset. Please acknowledge."
Alternate1.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Tu funkcjonariusz MOR-u, Tequila Sunset. Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Ваенны карабель кааліцыі Лука. Гэта афіцэр РГМ, Тэквілла Сансэт. Пацвердзіце прыём».

Alternate2.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. This is Detective Costeau of the RCM. Please acknowledge."
Alternate2.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Tu detektyw Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau z MOR-u. Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate2.belarusian: «Ваенны карабель кааліцыі Лучнік. Тут дэтэктыў Рафаэль Амброзіус Касто з РГМ. Пацвердзіце прыём».

Alternate3.english: "Coalition Warship Archer. This is Lieutenant Du Bois of the RCM. Please acknowledge."
Alternate3.polish: „Okręt Wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Tu porucznik Harrier Du Bois z MOR-u. Potwierdź odbiór”.
Alternate3.belarusian: «Ваенны карабель Кааліцыі «Лукнік». Тут лейтэнант Харыер Дэ Буас з РГМ. Пацвердзіце прыём».

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, this is Coalition Wars..."
links.english: "Firewalker, this is Coalition Warship Archer. We are acknowledging and accepting you."
links.polish: „Ognisty, tu okręt wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Słyszymy cię i akceptujemy połączenie”.
links.belarusian: "Агністы, гэта ваенны карабель кааліцыі "Лучнік". Мы цябе чуем і прымаем злучэнне".

Alternate1.english: "Officer Sunset, this is Coalition Warship Archer. We are acknowledging and accepting you."
Alternate1.polish: „Funkcjonariuszu Sunset, tu okręt wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Słyszymy cię i akceptujemy połączenie”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Афіцэр Санцэт, гэта ваенны карабель Кааліцыі «Лучнік». Чуем вас і прымаем сувязь».

Alternate2.english: "Detective Costeau, this is Coalition Warship Archer. We are acknowledging and accepting you."
Alternate2.polish: „Detektywie Costeau, tu okręt wojenny Koalicji Łucznik. Słyszymy cię i akceptujemy połączenie”.
Alternate2.belarusian: «Дэтэктыў Касто, тут ваенны карабель Кааліцыі Лучнік. Чуем вас і прымаем сувязь».
